transcripts.text: It was in 1969 that I was born again, at the age of nine years old, right in Amityville, New York.  And from that time to this day, I was nine years old when I was born again.  I'm 60 years old today.  And Jesus Christ has been the very center of all that I do and all that I am.  And so I've learned how to pray.  I've learned how to pray.  Even in this pandemic, even throughout all of this hysteria that's going on, I've learned how to call out to God.  And I call him and he hears me.  I'm glad that he hears me whenever I pray.  And so there are so many different songs that are going through my mind.  There are so many different songs that go through my mind.  But there's a song that just simply says, I call you holy.  Your name is holy.  You are so holy to me.  Holy you are and holy you'll be.  So help me out, musicians.  Help me out, saints.  Bishop, I remind this.  I call you holy.  Your name is holy.  You are so holy to me.  Everybody.  I call you holy.  Your name is holy, holy you are, and holy you will be.  I call you holy, sir.  I call you holy.  Your name is holy.
